hours_text:
## Hours 

Tuesday | 10 am–5 pm   
---|---  
Wednesday| 10 am–5 pm  
Thursday| 10 am–5 pm  
Friday| Noon–8 pm  
Saturday| 10 am–5 pm  
Sunday| Noon–5 pm  
Monday| Closed  
  
### Holiday Hours 

Christmas Eve | 10 am–5 pm   
---|---  
New Year's Eve | 10 am–5 pm   
  
We are closed on New Year’s Day, Juneteenth, July 4, Thanksgiving Day, and Christmas Day.

During inclement weather, we follow the Fort Worth Independent School District’s closure and delayed opening schedule. We will post alerts in the event of a closure. You can also visit [Fort Worth ISD’s website](https://www.fwisd.org/FWorthISD) or call us at 817-332-8451 for more information.

## Admission

### Admission to the Kimbell’s collection is always free.

| **Special Exhibitions**| [**Kimbell collection**](/collection)  
---|---|---  
Kimbell members| free| free  
adults| $18| free  
seniors 60+| $16| free  
students| $16| free  
children 6–11| $14| free  
children under 6| free| free   
  
**Exhibition Admission**  
[Tickets are now on sale for _Myth and Marble: Ancient Roman Sculpture from the Torlonia Collection_](https://secure.kimbellart.org/events?k=tickets), on view September 14, 2025, to January 25, 2026. All ticket sales are final.

Learn more about the exhibition [here](https://kimbellart.org/myth-and-marble).

[Book Tickets](https://secure.kimbellart.org/events?k=tickets)

**Member Admission**  
Members receive unlimited, free admission to all special exhibitions. Simply show your membership card when ...

accessibility_text:
Free admission to the [Kimbell Collection](/collection)

[Viewpoints Program](/participate/adults/accessible-programs-adults)

[Special Exhibitions ](/art-architecture/exhibitions)

[Contact Us](/form/contact-us)

We are committed to offering inclusive, meaningful experiences for all ages and abilities.

To plan your visit or share feedback on how we can make the Kimbell more accommodating, contact us at 817-332-8451, ext. 240, or [**email us**](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#6a0f0e1f090b1e0305042a010307080f0606071f190f1f074405180d)**.**

## Parking and Mobility Devices

Most areas of the Kimbell’s campus are accessible to people with limited mobility. We’re happy to answer any questions in order to make your visit as comfortable as possible. Call 817-332-8451 and press 0 to speak with a museum representative during museum hours.

Individuals are welcome to use personal wheelchairs, walkers, mobility scooters, and other aids throughout their visit. Wheelchairs, in limited numbers, are available for temporary use on a first-come, first-served basis; please inquire with an attendant at either building. 

The east entrance to the Kahn Building on Van Cliburn Way has accessible ramps on either side of the doors. Please note that the Kahn Building’s west entrance is not wheelchair accessible. The entrance to the Piano Pavilion is accessible through the Kimbell underground garage and from the group drop-off on Camp Bowie Boulevard. Accessible parking spaces are available in all of our...
collections_text:
# Homepage

Navigate to main content

EXHIBITION

##  [_Myth and Marble_ ](/myth-and-marble)

_Ancient Roman Sculpture from the Torlonia Collection_

Impressive figures of gods and goddesses, vivid portraits of emperors and their families, and masterfully carved funerary monuments highlight the artistic achievements of Rome's High Imperial Period in the first to second centuries AD.

[Book Tickets](/myth-and-marble)

Navigate to next section

NEWS

##  [The Kimbell Adds a Masterful Kota Reliquary Guardian Figure and a Rare Kwele Mask to Its Collection of African Art ](/news-and-stories/kimbell-reliquary-guardian-figure-and-kwele-mask)

The two sculptures are the first works from Gabon to enter the Kimbell’s collection.

[Read More](/news-and-stories/kimbell-reliquary-guardian-figure-and-kwele-mask)

Navigate to next section

EXHIBITION

##  [Caravaggio's _Judith Beheading Holofernes_ ](/caravaggio-judith-beheading-holofernes)

From the Palazzo Barberini, Rome

This painting, which ranks among Caravaggio's most groundbreaking masterpieces for its bold realism and the theatrical staging of its biblical subject is on view at the Kimbell for a limited time.

[Learn More](/caravaggio-judith-beheading-holofernes)

Navigate to next section
